events.name: DevOpsDays Singapore 2016
events.description: DevOpsDays Singapore is coming back in 2016! Some highlights of the conference this year • Mitchell Hashimoto, the creator of tools like Vagrant, Consul, Terraform  • Nicole Forsgren, chief researcher for the State of the Devops report • Multiple workshops to get hands on experience working with tool like Terraform, Consul, GoCD and Ansible Come learn from the best in the industry and be inspired by the DevOps journey others in the industry, some right here in Singapore have embarked on. through the workshops, you will be able to upskill yourself and get a kickstart on that tool or practise you have always wanted to get started with or get better at!  Here are some links to find out more and be a part of the event -  • Early bird sales are now on till August 15th! Get tickets for yourself or your team as soon as possible! • We are still accepting talk submissions till August 15th! Submit your talk now • We are looking for sponsors so if you are interested contact us at organizers-singapore-2016@devopsdays.org! Please do have a look at our prospectus We look forward to seeing many of you there! Cheers
events.location: Raffles Place Convention Center, 80 Bras Basah Road , Singapore

events.name: How to lead and win in a data life
events.description: Hi all! Adam (who spoke in June on Big Data, Small Machine) is back to share with us his thoughts on data leadership and building a successful career in the data science. We will follow his talk with a panel discussion between Adam and Koo (who is Co-founder/Practicum Director of Data Science Rex and Adjunct Lecturer at NUS-ISS, SMU & UniSIM). Kai Xin (data scientist from Lazada) will be moderating the panel.  Housekeeping  • Please refer to the new attendance policy before RSVP to this meetup. • RSVPs will open on Saturday, 1st Oct (12pm) and closes one day before event day. Event details 9.45am - 10am: Networking session [casual; small talk]  10am - 10.30am:  How to lead and win in a data life by Adam [casual level] 10.30am - 11am: Panel discussion on building a successful data science career (Adam, Koo, Kai Xin) [casual]  11am - 1130am: Networking session [casual; small talk]  [] : Suggested rating and topic; ranges from: newbie - casual - core - hardcore.  About our speakers: Adam has been in technology roles in a variety of industries, including online marketing, financial services, healthcare, and oil and gas. His background is in Applied Mathematics, he helps companies change and use data more effectively, and his technical interests include online learning systems, high-frequency/low-latency data processing systems, recommender systems, distributed systems, and functional programming. https://www.linkedin.com/in/aadrake Koo is an experienced Data Scientist/Analytics Instructor with an MBA degree & 10+ years of relevant experience. Personal research interest in using Data Science to make organizations more efficient & effective and assisting more people to understand & pursue Data Science. He has adjunct positions in local IHLs and trained hundreds of professional. Experienced in Statistical Modelling, Credit Scorecard, Business Intelligence, Data Management (ETL process, access rights management and so on) and Text Analytics. Familiar with SAS, R, Python, SQL, etc. https://www.linkedin.com/in/koopingshung Kai Xin is a data scientist at Lazada. Over the course of 5 years, he has built and deployed into production a variety of models that provide recommendations, text analytics, spam & fraud detection, segmentation and forecasting across domains like eCommerce, healthcare and consumer markets. https://sg.linkedin.com/in/thiakx RSVPs will open on Saturday, 1st Oct (12pm) and closes one day before event day. Do you have questions related to a career in data science, data culture, data leadership? Post them at the URL below. https://goo.gl/forms/mbW2RT5an00nwlbM2
events.location: Singapore Management University School of Information Systems Seminar Room 2-1, 80 Stamford Road, Level 2

events.name: We're Everywhere, Somewhere and Nowhere
events.description:
We're Everywhere, Somewhere and Nowhere
A Project by Bani Haykal
Saturday 8 October, 3 – 4pm | Expression Gallery (Level 4) 
Free Admission

What does the future of the Internet of Things hold for us? How does one navigate the digital quagmire and growing technological wilderness that is the Information Age? 

First presented in May, join us for the second part of Bani Haykal’s We’re Everywhere, Somewhere and Nowhere project that wraps around Big Bang Data, as he explores realities and implications of this seismic shift in his performance lecture. 

Presented in conjunction with Big Bang Data exhibition.

events.name: NUS Spectrum Music Festival 2016
events.description:
SPECTRUM MUSIC FESTIVAL
08 October 2016, Saturday
Solar Session: 3.30 - 7PM
Lunar Session: 7.30 - 11PM

►Ticket Details
 Solar Pass: $18
 Lunar Pass: $18
 Eclipse (both session): $28
⭐️ 4-for-3 Pass (single session): $54

►About Spectrum Music Festival
This music festival will be the first of its kind in NUS to focus on electronic music and the beautiful diversity of genres it brings to our lives. At this festival you will see experienced and budding electronic music artists of different backgrounds from across the island come together to share their original works! You will also see electronic music expressed in different forms, from live sets to DJ sets. Spectrum is a full day of incredible music by music lovers, for music lovers!

►Line Up
Solar Session:
synQ [DJ]
Three Hunters
Foreign Affairs
NARS.K
【 btcprox 】
Ocean's Children
Canvas Conversations
Disco Hue

Lunar Session:
Thievves. [Disco Hue]
Jeff Hue Official [Canvas Conversations]
Brannlum
Skice
Mitch Advent [Asmbly]
Axiam Music
SUTD Scratch [DJ]

►About NUS Electronic Music Lab
The NUS Electronic Music Lab (EML) is a member of the NUS Centre For The Arts. It is a collective of creatives that aims to develop the electronic music community in Singapore and the region through the use of various artforms. Through our activities we aim to foster a passionate supportive community, unafraid to challenge boundaries and share our art through outreach programs.
events.location: University Cultural Centre, 50 Kent Ridge Cres, Singapore 119279
